Articles.Content: Do any of them?

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, [\[email protected\]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) said:
> 
> 
> Do any of them?
> 

The only one I know of that does anything explicitly with gravity is Kerbal Health:

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedauthorid="141813" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed4294748460" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/155313-173-kerbal-health-137-2019-07-16/&do=embed" style="height:214px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

Note that many LS mods - <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS included - have some rotating parts with high bonuses to some life support stat, so it's often tracked indirectly to an extent.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, goldenpsp said:
> 
> 
> No
> 

Oh darn.  Do any of them do that?  Like you need to have a rotating chamber for them to live in or they go nutso or get unhealthy?

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, jpinard said:
> 
> 
> Oh darn.  Do any of them do that?  Like you need to have a rotating chamber for them to live in or they go nutso or get unhealthy?
> 

I don't know if any "require" it.  However MKS does have a rotating part that give them lots of habitation, which is a requirement for <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS.  You can roleplay that part of that habitation comes from gravity.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, goldenpsp said:
> 
> 
> I don't know if any "require" it.  However MKS does have a rotating part that give them lots of habitation, which is a requirement for <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS.  You can roleplay that part of that habitation comes from gravity.
> 

<abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> requires ample housing space over and above vanilla?  If so that's fantastic.

[@jpinard](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/89401-jpinard/), yes, the [Habitation](https://github.com/UmbraSpaceIndustries/USI-LS/wiki#habitation)component of <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS is "housing".

A sugestion : A ground experiment (akin to those introduced in Breakign ground DLC) to study plant growth. I know there is such a thing in the nom-o-matics, but it hink its better fit as a long term experiment.

This might be a stupid question but is there a reason why stock station parts dont have habitation values? For example this one:

![k5ePoqv.png](https://i.imgur.com/k5ePoqv.png)

Or is something with my install incorrect? Version 1.7.3

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Azalen said:
> 
> 
> This might be a stupid question but is there a reason why stock station parts dont have habitation values? For example this one:
> 

That's from Stockalike Station Parts Expansion Redux, not stock (try saying that ten times fast). The patch to make those parts work with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> LS is included in the station parts mod, but it doesn't patch any parts that have no crew capacity. I could see an argument for why crew tubes should add a small amount of hab multiplier, but I'm not aware of any parts that increase hab time without having crew capacity.  

Also, if nobody's welcomed you to the forums yet, welcome to the forums!

Thanks for the welcome ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

I mean it is called "Crew Tube" and when you play with <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> Life Support this part has no value, right? The whole point of building bigger space stations is for habitation (at least in my current view (early game, first station orbiting kerbin))?

Well, if a part is just for the movement of Kerbals, air and EC then it's arguable whether it should add to habitation.  It could be considered like a corridor in your house - it allows you to move between rooms but you don't sleep, recreate, relax, or work (i.e. live) there.
Does <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> need to be updated to work correctly with 1.8?

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, jpinard said:
> 
> 
> Does <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> need to be updated to work correctly with 1.8?
> 

The Firespitter mod(also managed by RoverDude) needs an update, and anything with dlls probably needs a re-compile.

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, Terwin said:
> 
> 
> The Firespitter mod(also managed by RoverDude) needs an update, and anything with dlls probably needs a re-compile.
> 

That's what I thought.  Thanks!

> 
> 
> 38 minutes ago, Terwin said:
> 
> 
> The Firespitter mod(also managed by RoverDude) needs an update, and anything with dlls probably needs a re-compile.
> 

Seems to work fine for me. But then, that might be because I'm using the version specifically listed as being updated for KSP 1.8 and released a good week ago.
FYI, 1.8.x compat versions are all up ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, rmaine said:
> 
> 
> Seems to work fine for me. But then, that might be because I'm using the version specifically listed as being updated for KSP 1.8 and released a good week ago.
> 

The <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> versions were preemptively updated by someone else and may not have been accurate for all <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods, but as you can see just above my post, RoverDude has just released a version that does work.

The catalog link in RoverDude's signature will have the definitive compatibility and latest versions of course.

> 
> 
> 11 hours ago, Terwin said:
> 
> 
> The <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> versions were preemptively updated by someone else and may not have been accurate for all <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods, but as you can see just above my post, RoverDude has just released a version that does work.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The catalog link in RoverDude's signature will have the definitive compatibility and latest versions of course.
> 

So I see. Makes me mildly curious how it came to be that someone else was able to update the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> version. But then I know very little about that end of <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>. I mostly don't need to know, though this does make me a little cautious about immediately accepting <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> updates in general.

> 
> 
> 47 minutes ago, rmaine said:
> 
> 
> So I see. Makes me mildly curious how it came to be that someone else was able to update the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> version. But then I know very little about that end of <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>. I mostly don't need to know, though this does make me a little cautious about immediately accepting <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> updates in general.
> 

It's just how <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> works.  In some cases there are mods where the auther never put their mod on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> but someone else created the file to list it.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, rmaine said:
> 
> 
> So I see. Makes me mildly curious how it came to be that someone else was able to update the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> version. But then I know very little about that end of <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>. I mostly don't need to know, though this does make me a little cautious about immediately accepting <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> updates in general.
> 

I'm recalling that the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> mods had been listed on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> as 1.\*+ Or "any" for some time, regardless of the actual game version they actually supported.

They get updated fairly quickly upon new game versions, so it never caused much grief.
I saw that the Nom-O-Matic 25000 can be tweakscaled. However from my tests, the production doesn't scale up, it's just visual.    1.7.3.

There's some code that bugs out when you have no crew on your vehicle. It seems like it tries to always assume 1, but does a division by zero for the fertilizer calculation.

![vhtStcs.png](https://imgur.com/vhtStcs.png)
I'm having a problem where it doesn't matter how much or how little habitation I have on the vessel, the habitation thing says indefinite. is that a disabled setting?

> 
> 
> 13 minutes ago, OutOfAblator said:
> 
> 
> I'm having a problem where it doesn't matter how much or how little habitation I have on the vessel, the habitation thing says indefinite. is that a disabled setting?
> 

Disabled by default.  From the main <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> page, click on the <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr>-LS icon on the toolbar.  It will open the settings and you can add Hab back into the mix.

> 
> 
> 28 minutes ago, OutOfAblator said:
> 
> 
> I'm having a problem where it doesn't matter how much or how little habitation I have on the vessel, the habitation thing says indefinite. is that a disabled setting?
> 

Where are you?  Kerbals don't have habitation issues on their home planet...
